example.para: The following example cancels deletion of the specified KMS key.

code.title: To cancel deletion of a KMS key

example.para: This example connects an AWS KMS custom key store to its backing key store. For an AWS CloudHSM key store, it connects the key store to its AWS CloudHSM cluster. For an external key store, it connects the key store to the external key store proxy that communicates with your external key manager. This operation does not return any data. To verify that the custom key store is connected, use the DescribeCustomKeyStores operation.

code.title: To connect a custom key store

example.para: The following example creates an alias for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To create an alias

example.para: This example creates a custom key store that is associated with an AWS CloudHSM cluster.

code.title: To create an AWS CloudHSM key store

example.para: This example creates an external key store that uses an Amazon VPC endpoint service to communicate with AWS KMS.

code.title: To create an external key store with VPC endpoint service connectivity

example.para: This example creates an external key store with public endpoint connectivity.

code.title: To create an external key store with public endpoint connectivity

example.para: The following example creates a grant that allows the specified IAM role to encrypt data with the specified KMS key.

code.title: To create a grant

example.para: The following example creates a symmetric KMS key for encryption and decryption. No parameters are required for this operation.

code.title: To create a KMS key

example.para: This example creates a KMS key that contains an asymmetric RSA key pair for encryption and decryption. The key spec and key usage can't be changed after the key is created.

code.title: To create an asymmetric RSA KMS key for encryption and decryption

example.para: This example creates a KMS key that contains an asymmetric elliptic curve (ECC) key pair for signing and verification. The key usage is required even though "SIGN_VERIFY" is the only valid value for ECC KMS keys. The key spec and key usage can't be changed after the key is created.

code.title: To create an asymmetric elliptic curve KMS key for signing and verification

example.para: This example creates a 384-bit symmetric HMAC KMS key. The GENERATE_VERIFY_MAC key usage value is required even though it's the only valid value for HMAC KMS keys. The key spec and key usage can't be changed after the key is created.

code.title: To create an HMAC KMS key

example.para: This example creates a multi-Region primary symmetric encryption key. Because the default values for all parameters create a symmetric encryption key, only the MultiRegion parameter is required for this KMS key.

code.title: To create a multi-Region primary KMS key

example.para: This example creates a KMS key with no key material. When the operation is complete, you can import your own key material into the KMS key. To create this KMS key, set the Origin parameter to EXTERNAL.

code.title: To create a KMS key for imported key material

example.para: This example creates a KMS key in the specified AWS CloudHSM key store. The operation creates the KMS key and its metadata in AWS KMS and creates the key material in the AWS CloudHSM cluster associated with the custom key store. This example requires the CustomKeyStoreId and Origin parameters.

code.title: To create a KMS key in an AWS CloudHSM key store

example.para: This example creates a KMS key in the specified external key store. It uses the XksKeyId parameter to associate the KMS key with an existing symmetric encryption key in your external key manager. This CustomKeyStoreId, Origin, and XksKeyId parameters are required in this operation.

code.title: To create a KMS key in an external key store

example.para: The following example decrypts data that was encrypted with a KMS key.

code.title: To decrypt data

example.para: The following example deletes the specified alias.

code.title: To delete an alias

example.para: This example deletes a custom key store from AWS KMS. This operation does not affect the backing key store, such as a CloudHSM cluster, external key store proxy, or your external key manager. This operation doesn't return any data. To verify that the operation was successful, use the DescribeCustomKeyStores operation.

code.title: To delete a custom key store from AWS KMS

example.para: The following example deletes the imported key material from the specified KMS key.

code.title: To delete imported key material

example.para: This example gets detailed information about all AWS KMS custom key stores in an AWS account and Region. To get all key stores, do not enter a custom key store name or ID.

code.title: To get detailed information about custom key stores in the account and Region

example.para: This example gets detailed information about a particular AWS CloudHSM key store by specifying its friendly name. To limit the output to a particular custom key store, provide either the custom key store name or ID.

code.title: To get detailed information about an AWS CloudHSM key store by specifying its friendly name

example.para: This example gets detailed information about an external key store by specifying its ID. The example external key store proxy uses public endpoint connectivity.

code.title: To get detailed information about an external key store by specifying its ID

example.para: This example gets detailed information about a particular external key store by specifying its friendly name. To limit the output to a particular custom key store, provide either the custom key store name or ID. The proxy URI path for this external key store includes an optional prefix. Also, because this example external key store uses VPC endpoint connectivity, the response includes the associated VPC endpoint service name.

code.title: To get detailed information about an external key store VPC endpoint connectivity by specifying its friendly name

example.para: The following example gets metadata for a symmetric encryption KMS key.

code.title: To get details about a KMS key

example.para: The following example gets metadata for an asymmetric RSA KMS key used for signing and verification.

code.title: To get details about an RSA asymmetric KMS key

example.para: The following example gets metadata for a multi-Region replica key. This multi-Region key is a symmetric encryption key. DescribeKey returns information about the primary key and all of its replicas.

code.title: To get details about a multi-Region key

example.para: The following example gets the metadata of an HMAC KMS key.

code.title: To get details about an HMAC KMS key

example.para: The following example gets the metadata of a KMS key in an AWS CloudHSM key store.

code.title: To get details about a KMS key in an AWS CloudHSM key store

example.para: The following example gets the metadata of a KMS key in an external key store.

code.title: To get details about a KMS key in an external key store

example.para: The following example disables the specified KMS key.

code.title: To disable a KMS key

example.para: The following example disables automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To disable automatic rotation of key material

example.para: This example disconnects an AWS KMS custom key store from its backing key store. For an AWS CloudHSM key store, it disconnects the key store from its AWS CloudHSM cluster. For an external key store, it disconnects the key store from the external key store proxy that communicates with your external key manager. This operation doesn't return any data. To verify that the custom key store is disconnected, use the DescribeCustomKeyStores operation.

code.title: To disconnect a custom key store from its CloudHSM cluster

example.para: The following example enables the specified KMS key.

code.title: To enable a KMS key

example.para: The following example enables automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To enable automatic rotation of key material

example.para: The following example encrypts data with the specified KMS key.

code.title: To encrypt data

example.para: The following example generates a 256-bit symmetric data encryption key (data key) in two formats. One is the unencrypted (plainext) data key, and the other is the data key encrypted with the specified KMS key.

code.title: To generate a data key

example.para: This example generates an RSA data key pair for encryption and decryption. The operation returns a plaintext public key and private key, and a copy of the private key that is encrypted under a symmetric encryption KMS key that you specify.

code.title: To generate an RSA key pair for encryption and decryption

example.para: This example returns an asymmetric elliptic curve (ECC) data key pair. The private key is encrypted under the symmetric encryption KMS key that you specify. This operation doesn't return a plaintext (unencrypted) private key.

code.title: To generate an asymmetric data key pair without a plaintext key

example.para: The following example generates an encrypted copy of a 256-bit symmetric data encryption key (data key). The data key is encrypted with the specified KMS key.

code.title: To generate an encrypted data key

example.para: This example generates an HMAC for a message, an HMAC KMS key, and a MAC algorithm. The algorithm must be supported by the specified HMAC KMS key.

code.title: To generate an HMAC for a message

example.para: The following example generates 32 bytes of random data.

code.title: To generate random data

example.para: The following example retrieves the key policy for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To retrieve a key policy

example.para: The following example retrieves the status of automatic annual rotation of the key material for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To retrieve the rotation status for a KMS key

example.para: The following example retrieves the public key and import token for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To retrieve the public key and import token for a KMS key

example.para: This example gets the public key of an asymmetric RSA KMS key used for encryption and decryption. The operation returns the key spec, key usage, and encryption or signing algorithms to help you use the public key correctly outside of AWS KMS.

code.title: To download the public key of an asymmetric KMS key

example.para: The following example imports key material into the specified KMS key.

code.title: To import key material into a KMS key

example.para: The following example lists aliases.

code.title: To list aliases

example.para: The following example lists grants for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To list grants for a KMS key

example.para: The following example lists key policies for the specified KMS key.

code.title: To list key policies for a KMS key

example.para: The following example lists KMS keys.

code.title: To list KMS keys

example.para: The following example lists tags for a KMS key.

code.title: To list tags for a KMS key

example.para: The following example lists the grants that the specified principal (identity) can retire.

code.title: To list grants that the specified principal can retire

example.para: The following example attaches a key policy to the specified KMS key.

code.title: To attach a key policy to a KMS key

example.para: The following example reencrypts data with the specified KMS key.

code.title: To reencrypt data

example.para: This example creates a multi-Region replica key in us-west-2 of a multi-Region primary key in us-east-1.

code.title: To replicate a multi-Region key in a different AWS Region

example.para: The following example retires a grant.

code.title: To retire a grant

example.para: The following example revokes a grant.

code.title: To revoke a grant

example.para: The following example schedules the specified KMS key for deletion.

code.title: To schedule a KMS key for deletion

example.para: This operation uses the private key in an asymmetric elliptic curve (ECC) KMS key to generate a digital signature for a given message.

code.title: To digitally sign a message with an asymmetric KMS key.

example.para: This operation uses the private key in an asymmetric RSA signing KMS key to generate a digital signature for a message digest. In this example, a large message was hashed and the resulting digest is provided in the Message parameter. To tell KMS not to hash the message again, the MessageType field is set to DIGEST

code.title: To digitally sign a message digest with an asymmetric KMS key.

example.para: The following example tags a KMS key.

code.title: To tag a KMS key

example.para: The following example removes tags from a KMS key.

code.title: To remove tags from a KMS key

example.para: The following example updates the specified alias to refer to the specified KMS key.

code.title: To update an alias

example.para: This example changes the friendly name of the AWS KMS custom key store to the name that you specify. This operation does not return any data. To verify that the operation worked, use the DescribeCustomKeyStores operation.

code.title: To edit the friendly name of a custom key store

example.para: This example tells AWS KMS the password for the kmsuser crypto user in the AWS CloudHSM cluster that is associated with the AWS KMS custom key store. (It does not change the password in the CloudHSM cluster.) This operation does not return any data.

code.title: To edit the password of an AWS CloudHSM key store

example.para: This example changes the AWS CloudHSM cluster that is associated with an AWS CloudHSM key store to a related cluster, such as a different backup of the same cluster. This operation does not return any data. To verify that the operation worked, use the DescribeCustomKeyStores operation.

code.title: To associate the custom key store with a different, but related, AWS CloudHSM cluster.

example.para: To update the proxy authentication credential for your external key store, specify both the RawSecretAccessKey and the AccessKeyId, even if you are changing only one of the values. You can use this feature to fix an invalid credential or to change the credential when the external key store proxy rotates it.

code.title: To update the proxy authentication credential of an external key store

example.para: This example updates the proxy URI path for an external key store

code.title: To edit the proxy URI path of an external key store.

example.para: To change the external key store proxy connectivity option from public endpoint connectivity to VPC endpoint service connectivity, in addition to changing the XksProxyConnectivity value, you must change the XksProxyUriEndpoint value to reflect the private DNS name associated with the VPC endpoint service. You must also add an XksProxyVpcEndpointServiceName value.

code.title: To update the proxy connectivity of an external key store to VPC_ENDPOINT_SERVICE

example.para: The following example updates the description of the specified KMS key.

code.title: To update the description of a KMS key

example.para:
The following UpdatePrimaryRegion example changes the multi-Region replica key in the eu-central-1 Region to the primary key. The current primary key in the us-west-1 Region becomes a replica key.
The KeyId parameter identifies the current primary key in the us-west-1 Region. The PrimaryRegion parameter indicates the Region of the replica key that will become the new primary key.
This operation does not return any output. To verify that primary key is changed, use the DescribeKey operation.

code.title: To update the primary Region of a multi-Region KMS key

example.para: This operation uses the public key in an elliptic curve (ECC) asymmetric key to verify a digital signature within AWS KMS.

code.title: To use an asymmetric KMS key to verify a digital signature

example.para: This operation uses the public key in an RSA asymmetric signing key pair to verify the digital signature of a message digest. Hashing a message into a digest before sending it to KMS lets you verify messages that exceed the 4096-byte message size limit. To indicate that the value of Message is a digest, use the MessageType parameter

code.title: To use an asymmetric KMS key to verify a digital signature on a message digest

example.para: This example verifies an HMAC for a particular message, HMAC KMS keys, and MAC algorithm. A value of 'true' in the MacValid value in the response indicates that the HMAC is valid.

code.title: To verify an HMAC
